errors.40036: Default storage policy cannot be deleted.
errors.40037: Some file blob(s) are using this policy, please delete those file blobs first.
errors.40038: {{message}} group(s) are using this policy, please unlink those groups first.
errors.40040: Cannot perform such action on system group.
errors.40041: {{message}} users are still in this group, please delete or unlink those users first.
errors.40042: Cannot change the group of system user group.
errors.40043: Cannot perform such action on default user.
errors.40046: Cannot perform such action on master node.
errors.40060: Slave node cannot send callback request to master, please check master node setting: Basic - Site Information - Site URL, please make sure slave node can access this url. ({{message}})
errors.40086: The node is being used by the following storage policies: {{message}}.

summary.siteURLNotMatch: The site URL you set does not contains the current one ({{current}}), do you want to add it to the list?
summary.setAsPrimaryDes: Set {{current}} as the primary site URL, used for communication with external services and receiving callbacks. Please use a URL that can be accessed by WAN.
summary.setAsSecondaryDes: Add {{current}} to secondary URLs, Cloudreve will automatically select whether to use it based on the URL actually accessed by the user.
summary.siteURLDescription: This setting is very important, make sure it matches the actual URL of your site. You can change this setting in Settings - Basic.
summary.offlineLicenseDes: Cloudreve will automatically update the offline license before it expires if your server is connected to the network.
summary.volPurchase: The client VOL license needs to be purchased separately from the <0>License Management Dashboard</0>. The VOL license allows your users to connect to your site using the <1>Cloudreve iOS</1> for free, without the need for users to pay for a subscription for the iOS app itself. After purchasing a license, please click "Refresh offline license" below.
summary.manualRefreshDes: Failed to refresh offline license automatically, please try to log in to the <0>License Management Dashboard</0> to get the latest offline license and paste it below.

queue.queueName_io_intenseDes: Queue for handling large amounts of IO operations, including: storage policy transfer, decompression, compression.
queue.queueName_media_metaDes: Used to extract metadata from media files.
queue.queueName_recycleDes: Used to delete expired file blobs.
queue.queueName_thumbDes: Used to generate thumbnails for files.
queue.queueName_remote_downloadDes: Used to process remote download tasks.
queue.workerNumDes: Maximum number of tasks to be executed in parallel in the task queue
queue.maxExecutionDes: Maximum execution time (seconds) for a task, after which the task will be terminated.
queue.backoffFactorDes: Growth factor for task retry time intervals.
queue.backoffMaxDurationDes: Maximum backoff time (seconds) for task retries.
queue.maxRetryDes: Maximum number of retries after a task failure.
queue.retryDelayDes: Initial delay time (seconds) for task retries.

settings.oidcDes: OpenID Connect (OIDC) is an open authentication protocol for identity verification between different systems. After creating an application in a third-party identity platform, please add <0>{{url}}</0> to the "Redirect URI" field. For more details, please refer to the <1>documentation</1>.
settings.clientIDDes: The client ID of the application created in the third-party identity platform.
settings.clientSecretDes: The client secret of the application created in the third-party identity platform.
settings.scopeDes: Additional scopes to request, separated by commas <0>,</0>. By default, Cloudreve will request <0>openid</0>, <0>email</0> and <0>profile</0>; no need to repeat here.
settings.oidcWellknownDes: Wellknown document of the third-party identity platform, containing the configuration information of OpenID Connect.
settings.oidcWellknownUrlDes: URL of the wellknown document of the third-party identity platform, such as <0>https://accounts.google.com/.well-known/openid-configuration</0>.
settings.domainNotLicensedDes: The site URL you set contains an unauthorized domain, please add this subdomain in the <0>License Management Dashboard</0> and click the button below to update the license and try again.
settings.extractMediaMetaDes: Extract media file metadata for display and search. By default, non-local storage policies will only use the "Native in storage policy" generator. You can extend the thumbnail capability of third-party storage policies by enabling the "Extractor proxy" feature in storage policy setting page. For more details, please refer to the <0>documentation</0>.
settings.exifDes: Extract EXIF metadata from image files for display and search.
settings.musicDes: Extract metadata from music files, including title, artist, album, etc.
settings.ffprobeDes: Use FFprobe to extract metadata from video and audio files.
settings.maxSizeLocalDes: Maximum file size for metadata extraction when the file is stored in local storage policy, 0 means no limit.
settings.maxSizeRemoteDes: Maximum file size for metadata extraction when the file is stored in third-party storage policies, 0 means no limit.
settings.exifBruteForceDes: When enabled, the entire file will be scanned to find EXIF data if it cannot be found in the standard header location. This may increase processing time but can find EXIF data in non-standard locations.
settings.musicCoverDes: Extract album cover from music files, supports ID3 (v1, 2.2, 2.3 and 2.4) container. This generator depends on any other image thumbnail generator (Cloudreve built-in or VIPS).
settings.notAppliedToNativeGenerator: {{prefix}}Not applicable to native generator of storage policies.
settings.fileBlobMarginDes: When the same file Blob is requested multiple times, if the initial URL has a remaining validity period greater than the margin, the same URL will be reused.
settings.fileBlobTimeoutDes: Limit the validity period of the temporary URL obtained when users open or download files, only applicable to local storage policies, WebDAV, or files downloaded through Cloudreve relaying.
settings.wopiSessionTimeoutDes: Limit the validity period of a single session when users edit files using WOPI. After expiration, users need to reopen the file from Cloudreve.
settings.oauthRefresh: Refresh interval for OAuth storage policy
settings.oauthRefreshDes: Set how often to refresh the OAuth credentials for storage policies (e.g. OneDrive) that require OAuth. This can prevent credential expiration due to long periods of inactivity
settings.transitParallelNumDes: The maximum number of parallel uploads when a single server-side file relaying transfer task contains multiple files.
settings.failedChunkRetry: Maximum number of retries for chunk upload failures
settings.failedChunkRetryDes: The maximum number of retries for chunk upload failures, only applicable to server-side uploads or relaying transfers.
settings.cacheChunksDes:
If enabled, the chunk data will be cached in the system temporary directory during streaming transfer, so that it can be used for retrying failed chunk uploads;
 If disabled, streaming transfer chunk uploads will not take up extra disk space, but the entire upload will fail immediately if the chunk upload fails.
settings.folderPropsTimeoutDes: The validity period of the result cache when users calculate folder statistics (size, number of files, etc.).
settings.slaveAPIExpirationDes: The signature validity period used by the master node when accessing the slave node API.
settings.uploadSessionDes: In a valid upload session period, for supported storage policies, users can resume unfinished tasks. The maximum value that can be set is limited by the rules of different storage policy providers.
settings.wopiDes: Extend Cloudreve's online preview and editing capabilities by integrating with online document processing systems that support the WOPI protocol. Please fill in the WOPI service discovery address here, such as <0>https://example.com/hosting/discovery</0>. For more details, please refer to <1>documentation</1>.
settings.drawioHostDes: You can use URL for self-hosted instance.
settings.openInNewDes: If checked, it will directly pop up a new tab to open this application.
settings.maxSizeDes: The maximum file size supported by this application. 0 means no limit. If the file exceeds this size, it will still be opened, but users will be warned.
settings.srcEncodedVar: URL-encoded file Blob temporary access URL
settings.srcBase64Var: Base64-encoded File blob temporary access URL
settings.versionEntityVar: The Blob ID of the opened file version, empty means the latest version.
settings.userIdVar: User ID, empty when not logged in.
settings.viewerPlatformDes: Select the corresponding platform to display the application only on that platform.
settings.displayNameDes: Display name to users, support i18next key.
settings.newFileActionDes: By adding this mapping, users will see this application option when clicking the "New" button.
settings.builtInIconUrlDes: This built-in application has a default icon. When the icon URL is left blank, the default icon will be used.
settings.viewerUrlDes: URL of customized application, <0>magical variables</0> are supported.
settings.mimeMappingDes: MIME type mapping in JSON format, where the key is the file extension and the value is the MIME type. Cloudreve will determine the file MIME type based on the file extension and this setting.
settings.mapProviderDes: Map provider used to display media location information.
settings.tileTypeDes: Default tile type for Google Maps.
settings.maxPageSizeDes: Limit the maximum number of files that users can adjust per page.
settings.maxRecursiveSearchDes: The maximum number of recursive searches allowed when searching for files. If the number of files searched exceeds this limit, the search will stop and warn the user.
settings.maxBatchSizeDes: The maximum number of files that users can operate in a batch, only the top-level will be counted, and the number of files under subdirectories will not be counted.
settings.cursorPaginationDes: More files will be automatically loaded when the user scrolls to the bottom. This method performs better for large file lists, but the total number of pages cannot be seen.
settings.offsetPaginationDes: Pagination navigation will be displayed at the bottom of the page; users can see the total number of pages and jump to a specific page. This method performs slightly worse for large file lists.
settings.defaultPaginationDes: Cursor pagination will be forced to use when searching, regardless of the above settings.
settings.publicResourceMaxAgeDes: The max age of cache for publicly accessible static resources (e.g. files, thumbnails and user profile pictures).
settings.cronDes: {{des}} A correct <0>Cron syntax</0> is required here. Restarting Cloudreve is needed to take effect.
settings.entityCollectIntervalDes: Set how often to scan and delete expired file blobs.
settings.trashBinIntervalDes: Set how often to scan and delete expired files in the trash bin.
settings.logtoNameDes: Name of the sign-in method, displayed to users. Default is "SSO", support i18next key.
settings.logtoDirectSSODes: If you want to skip the Logto login screen and directly jump to the third-party login or SSO, please fill in the identifier of the social connector here. For details, please refer to <0>Logto documentation</0>.
settings.logtoEndpointDes: The Logto endpoint url obtained from the application management panel, which can be a self-hosted instance.
settings.logtoKeyDes: Application secret created in the application management page.
settings.logtoAppIDDes: Application ID created in the application management page.
settings.logtoDes: With <0>Logto</0>, you can achieve more third-party platform sign-ins, such as Apple, GitHub, Microsoft Entra ID, Google, SMS, etc. Please create a "Traditional Web Application" in the Logto management portal and add <1>{{url}}</1> to the "Redirect URIs".
settings.logoDes: URL of the LOGO, please provide different logos for dark and light modes.
settings.tosUrlDes: Will be displayed in the footer of the login or registration page, leave it blank to not display.
settings.privacyUrlDes: Will be displayed in the footer of the login or registration page, leave it blank to not display.
settings.secondaryDes: You can also add other secondary URLs, Cloudreve will automatically select whether to use it based on the URL actually accessed by the user.
settings.primarySiteURLDes: Primary site URL is used for communication with external services and receiving callbacks (e.g. storage provider), please use a URL that can be accessed by WAN.
settings.siteDescriptionDes: Description of the website, which may be displayed in the shared page summary.
settings.customFooterHTMLDes: Custom HTML code inserted at the bottom of the page.
settings.announcementDes: Announcements displayed to logged-in users. Blank value will not be displayed. After this content is changed, all users will see the announcement again.
settings.smallIconDes: URL of the small icon with the ico as extension.
settings.mediumIconDes: URL of the medium icon, prefer size at 192x192, png format.
settings.largeIconDes: URL of the medium icon, prefer size at 512x512, png format. This icon will also be shown while switching account in iOS app.
settings.displayModeDes: The display mode of a PWA application after it's installed.
settings.themeColorDes: CSS color value that affect the color of the status bar on the PWA launch screen, the status bar in the content page, and the address bar.
settings.webauthnNoHttps: Web Authn requires your website to be HTTPS enabled, and please confirm that in Settings - Basic - Site URL also uses HTTPS.
settings.allowNewRegistrationsDes: After disabled, no new users can be registered, unless manually added by admins.
settings.emailActivationDes: After enabled, new users need to click the activation link in the email to complete signups. Please make sure the <0>email delivery settings</0> are correct, otherwise the activation email will not be delivered.
settings.captchaForSignupDes: Whether to enable the captcha for signups.
settings.captchaForLoginDes: Whether to enable the captcha for logins.
settings.captchaForResetDes: Whether to enable the captcha for resetting password.
settings.webauthnDes: Whether to allow users to sign-in with hardware authentication devices, such as: face, fingerprint or USB key; the site must enable HTTPS.
settings.defaultSymbolicsDes: Default share shortcuts in the root directory of new users. Please search for share links by ID, you can see the ID on the left side of the <0>share list</0>.
settings.defaultGroupDes: The initial user group after user registration.
settings.testSMTPTooltip: Cloudreve will use your current SMTP settings to send a test email, no need to save settings before testing.
settings.senderNameDes: The sender's name displayed in the email.
settings.smtpServerDes: SMTP server address, without port number.
settings.smtpUsernameDes: SMTP username, generally the same as the sender address.
settings.replyToAddressDes: The mailbox used to receive reply emails when users reply to emails sent by the system.
settings.enforceSSLDes: Whether to enforce an SSL encrypted connection. If you cannot send emails, you can turn this off and Cloudreve will try to use STARTTLS and decide whether to use encrypted connections.
settings.smtpTTLDes: SMTP connections established during the TTL period will be reused by new mail delivery requests.
settings.activateNewUserDes: Template for activation email after new user registration.
settings.workerNumDes: The maximum number of tasks to be executed in parallel by the master node task queue, restarting Cloudreve is needed to take effect.
settings.tempFolderDes: Used to store temporary files generated by tasks such as decompression, compression, etc.
settings.textEditMaxSize: Max size of editable document files
settings.textEditMaxSizeDes: The maximum size of a document file that can be edited online, files beyond this size cannot be edited online. This setting applies to online Web editors such as plain text, code and Office documents (WOPI).
settings.resetConnectionDes: If enabled, the server will force to reset the connection if upload verification fails.
settings.avatarFilePathDes: Path to save user's avatar files, relative to the Cloudreve data folder.
settings.avatarSizeDes: Maximum size of avatar files that users can upload.
settings.avatarImageSizeDes: Selected profile image will be resized to the given size, in pixels.
settings.thumbnailDoc: For more information about thumbnail, see the <0>document</0>.
settings.thumbMaxSizeDes: The maximum original file size for which thumbnails can be generated, thumbnails will not be generated if files exceed this size.
settings.generatorProxyWarning: By default, non-local storage policies will only use the "Native in storage policy" generator. You can extend the thumbnail capability of third-party storage policies by enabling the "Generator proxy" feature in storage policy setting page. For more details, please refer to the <0>documentation</0>.
settings.policyBuiltinDes: Use the native API from storage provider to process thumbnails. For local and S3 policy, this generator is not available and will automatically fallback to other generators. For other storage policies, please go to storage policy setting page to configure this generator.
settings.cloudreveBuiltinDes: Only images in PNG, JPEG, GIF formats are supported using Cloudreve's built-in image processing capabilities.
settings.libreOfficeDes: Use LibreOffice to generate thumbnails for Office documents. This generator depends on any other image thumbnail generator (Cloudreve built-in or VIPS).
settings.librawDes: Use LibRaw's DCRaw sample program, or the original DCRaw executable to generate thumbnails for RAW images.
settings.vipsDes: Use libvips to process thumbnail images, support more image formats, and consume less resources.
settings.thumbDependencyWarning: LibreOffice or music cover generator depend on Cloudreve built-in or VIPS generators, please enable either one.
settings.ffmpegDes: Use FFmpeg to generate video thumbnails.
settings.executableDes: The path or command of the third-party generator executable.
settings.generatorExtsDes: List of available file extensions for this generator, please use comma , to separate multiple ones.
settings.ffmpegSeekDes: Define the thumbnail interception time, it is recommended to choose a smaller value to speed up the generation process. If the actual length of the video is exceeded, the thumbnail generation will fail.
settings.proxyPolicyListDes: Multi-selectable. If enabled, files whose storage policy does not support native generation, its thumbnails will be proxy generated by the Cloudreve.
settings.thumbSuffixDes: The suffix appended to the original Blob file name for the generated thumbnail,
settings.thumbQualityDes: Compression quality percentage, valid only for jpg encoding.
settings.capInstanceURLDes: The URL of your self-hosted Cap server. For more details, see the <0>standalone mode documentation</0>.
settings.capSiteKeyDes: The site key from your Cap server dashboard.
settings.capSecretKeyDes: The secret key from your Cap server dashboard.
settings.capAssetServerDes: Choose the source for loading Cap captcha static assets. Using self-deployed server requires setting environment variables on the server side, please refer to <0>enable asset server</0>.
settings.captchaElement: Elements inside of the captcha image.
settings.siteKeyDes: You can find it at <0>App Management Page</0>.
settings.siteSecretDes: You can find it at <0>App Management Page</0>.
settings.secretIDDes: You can find it at <0>Access Management Page</0>.
settings.secretKeyDes: You can find it at <0>Access Management Page</0>.
settings.tCaptchaAppIDDes: You can find it at <0>Captcha Management Page</0>.
settings.tCaptchaSecretKeyDes: You can find it at <0>Captcha Management Page</0>.
settings.staticResourceCacheDes: Max age of cache for publicly accessible static resources (e.g. local policy source link, download link).
settings.enableCreditDes: Enable credit system to allow users to set prices for their share links.
settings.creditPriceDes: Price for recharging credit points with money (in minimum currency unit). Fill 0 to disable credit recharge.
settings.shareScoreRateDes: Percentage (1-100) of credit points that share owners receive when their share links are purchased.
settings.cronNotifyUserDes: Scan and send email reminders to over-limit users,
settings.cronBanUserDes: Scan and ban users exceeding storage limits and buffer periods
settings.anonymousPurchaseDes: Allow non-logged-in users to purchase share links directly
settings.shopNavEnabledDes: Display 'Shop' items in the sidebar navigation
settings.currencyCodeDes: Three-letter currency code (e.g., USD, CNY, EUR)
settings.providerName: Provider name, used to display to users.
settings.customProviderDes: Create a plugin to connect to other payment gateways, see <0>documentation</0> for further details.
settings.storageProductsDes: Configure products that users can purchase to extend their storage space.
settings.chipLabelHelp: A short text label displayed next to the product name
settings.pointsHelp: Number of points required to purchase this product
settings.groupProductsDes: Configure products that users can purchase to join specific user groups.
settings.groupIdHelp: The user group to upgrade to after purchasing this product.
settings.descriptionHelp: Enter features or benefits, one per line
settings.receiptEmailTemplateDes: Email template sent to users when a payment is confirmed.
settings.activationEmailTemplateDes: Email template sent to users to activate their accounts.
settings.quotaExceededEmailTemplateDes: Email template sent to users when they exceed their storage quota.
settings.resetPasswordEmailTemplateDes: Email template sent to users when they request a password reset.
settings.languageCodeDes: Please select the language you want to add.
settings.emailSubjectDes: The subject line of the email.
settings.emailBodyDes: HTML content of the email. You can use <0>magic variables</0> to customize the email content.
settings.themeOptionsDes: Configure custom theme options for your site. These themes will be available for users to select in their preferences.
settings.invalidThemeConfig: Invalid theme configuration. Please check your JSON syntax.
settings.duplicateThemeColor: A theme with this primary color already exists. Please choose a different color.
settings.themeDes: Full available configurations can be referred at <0>Default theme viewer - Material-UI</0>.
settings.auditLogDes: Configure which events should be recorded. Some events might be used by the system to provide additional features, e.g. file activity and sign in activity.
settings.systemEventsDes: Events related to system operations and status.
settings.userEventsDes: Events related to user accounts, authentication, and profile changes.
settings.fileEventsDes: Events related to file operations such as upload, download, and modification.
settings.shareEventsDes: Events related to file sharing and link access.
settings.versionEventsDes: Events related to file version management.
settings.mediaEventsDes: Events related to media processing such as thumbnail generation.
settings.filesystemEventsDes: Events related to filesystem operations such as mounting and archive handling.
settings.webdavEventsDes: Events related to WebDAV account management and access.
settings.paymentEventsDes: Events related to payments, points, and membership management.
settings.emailEventsDes: Events related to email sending and notifications.
settings.toggleAllDes: Enable or disable all events in this category.
settings.tempPathDes: The directory for storing temporary files, relative to the Cloudreve data directory. Please ensure that no queue tasks are running before modifying it.
settings.siteIDDes: A unique ID for identifying the site, generally not needed to be modified.
settings.siteSecretKeyDes: The master key used to encrypt user tokens and signatures. After rotation, all user tokens and signatures will be invalid. It takes effect after restarting Cloudreve.
settings.hashidSaltDes: The salt value used to generate HashID. Please be cautious when changing it, as it will invalidate existing direct links and share links.
settings.accessTokenTTLDes: The TTL of access tokens, in seconds.
settings.refreshTokenTTLDes: The TTL of refresh tokens, in seconds. It affects the duration of user login status.
settings.cronGarbageCollectDes: Set how often to scan and recycle expired data in temporary files and KV storage.
settings.startWithProtocol: Must start with http:// or https://
settings.tlsWarning: The current site is using https, filling in an http URL here may cause exceptions.
settings.clearBlobUrlCacheDes: To increase cache hit rate, Cloudreve caches and reuses Blob URLs. When the CDN address or other settings change, please clear the cache.

giftCodes.giftCodesDescription: Manage gift codes that users can redeem to obtain points, storage space, or group membership.
giftCodes.giftCodeQuantityHelp: Number of gift codes to generate
giftCodes.giftCodePointsAmountHelp: Number of points to credit when code is redeemed
giftCodes.generatedCodesDescription: Copy these gift codes to share with users. Each code can be used once.
giftCodes.duratonTimesDes: How many quantities of the product is included in each gift code.

policy.deletePolicyConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the storage policy {{name}}?
policy.streamSaverDes: When enabled, users' download requests will be handled by the browser. Due to the OneDrive storage policy limitation, the file name of the file downloaded directly by users cannot be the same as the file name in Cloudreve, using the browser to handle downloads can solve this problem.
policy.httpsRequired: Entra ID application requires HTTPS redirect URL, but the current site is using HTTP, which may cause redirect failure after login, please manually replace the HTTPS in the browser address bar with HTTP.
policy.redirectUrlDes: The current display is the latest redirect URL that meets the requirements. Please confirm if the redirect URL in the application settings is consistent with the current one.
policy.authorizeOneDriveDes: Please confirm if the following Entra ID application information is still valid. If needed, please make changes.
policy.notGranted: No authorized account, storage policy cannot be used.
policy.grantedNotRefresh: Account authorized, credential not refreshed since last startup.
policy.batchDeleteSizeDes: Limit the maximum number of files that can be deleted in a single API request. This setting will not affect user batch file deletion. If not filled, the default value <0>1000</0> will be used. This is the maximum allowed value for official S3 API.
policy.bucketDomainDes: Fill in the CDN-accelerated domain or custom CNAME domain you have bound for the storage bucket.
policy.thisIsACustomDomainDes: If you have bound a custom domain to the storage bucket, and need to manage the bucket via the custom domain, please check this option. After enabled, Cloudreve will not attempt to append the Bucket name in the request domain.
policy.downloadRelayDes: When enabled, users' download requests will be proxied by Cloudreve.
policy.skipSignDes: If you have enabled "Use source auth" for this domain in bucket settings, please check this option.
policy.downloadCdnDes: The host, protocol, and port of the URL that users use to access files will be replaced with the CDN host you specified.
policy.mediaExtractorProxyDes: Enable this feature to extract media metadata from files that are not supported by the storage provider's native extractors. Please configure the media extractor in <0>Media processing</0>.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtsGeneralDes: Separated by commas, empty value means disable <0>{{name}}</0>.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtsRemote: For slave storage, the default support is EXIF and music metadata, you can override this by configuring the slave node with more extractors.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtOss: The Intelligent Media Management (IMM) service supports processing audio, video, and images. Image processing does not require manual configuration, but if you need to process audio or video, you need to manually activate IMM and bind it to the Bucket, please refer to <0>document</0> for binding. After binding, please add the extensions you want to process to the above field.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtQiniu: The Qiniu DORA service supports processing common audio, video, and images, no additional configuration is required, please fill in the extensions you want to process above.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtCos: The Tencent Cloud Data Processing service supports processing audio, video, and images. Image processing does not require manual configuration, but if you need to process audio or video, please first go to <0>Tencent Cloud Data Processing</0> to activate and bind the storage bucket, then go to Bucket settings - Media processing to activate the image processing service. After binding, please add the extensions you want to process to the above field.
policy.nativeMediaMetaExtObs: The image processing service supports <0>extracting image EXIF</0>. No manual configuration is required, just add the extensions you want to process above.
policy.thumbProxyDes: Enable this feature to generate thumbnails for files that do not meet the native thumbnail conditions. Cloudreve will try to generate thumbnails and upload them to the storage side. Please configure the thumbnail generator in <0>Media processing</0>.
policy.nativeThumbnailMaxSizeDes: Enter 0 to disable the size limit, files larger than this size will not use native thumbnails.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralDes: Separated by commas, empty value means disable native thumb, for the file extensions listed above, Cloudreve will use the native thumbnail feature of the storage provider to generate thumbnails.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralRemote: For slave storage, the builtin support is simple image and music cover thumbnails, you can override this by configuring the slave node with more generators.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralOss: For Alibaba Cloud OSS storage, <0>image processing</0> service will be used to generate thumbnails.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralQiniu: For Qiniu Cloud storage, <0>image basic processing(imageView2)</0> service will be used to generate thumbnails.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralCos: For Tencent Cloud COS storage, <0>Tencent Cloud Data Processing</0> service will be used to generate thumbnails.
policy.nativeThumbNailsGeneralObs: For Huawei Cloud OBS storage, <0>image processing</0> service will be used to generate thumbnails.
policy.preallocateDes: When enabled, the user's upload request will be pre-allocated disk space on the storage node, only effective on Linux or Darwin.
policy.uploadRelayDes: If enabled, users' upload requests will be relayed to the storage node via Cloudreve, due to the inability to perform chunked uploads, please adjust the maximum upload size limit of the web server accordingly.
policy.nodeDes: Please select a slave node for file storage, you can create or manage slave storage nodes in <0>Node list</0>.
policy.noBindedGroupWarning: The current storage policy is not bound to any user group, please go to <0>Group list</0> to bind the current storage policy to a user group.
policy.nameRuleImmutable: Modifying settings will not affect existing files in the storage policy. The Blob path is fixed after creation, even if the magic variables in it change, the path will not be updated.
policy.uniqueVarRequired: Please include at least one unique variable: {{uuid}}, {{randomkey8}}, {{randomkey16}}.
policy.blobFolderNamingDes: The directory where file Blobs are stored, you can use <0>magic variables</0>.
policy.blobNameDes: The name of the file Blob, you can use <0>magic variables</0>, make sure it's absolutely unique, even for multiple uploads of the same file name in same path in a short time.
policy.name: Name
policy.childPolicyDes: Select the child storage policies to add to the load balance pool.
policy.selectPoliciesDes: Select storage policies to add to the load balance pool.
policy.loadBalanceDes: When using the load balanced storage policy, new uploads will be randomly distributed to different child storage policies based on weight.
policy.enterFileExt: Separated by semi-colon commas, leave blank to allow all file extensions.
policy.chunkSizeDes: Specify the chunk size for chunked uploads. A value of 0 means no chunked uploads are used, but the maximum upload size may be limited by the web server.
policy.chunkSizeDesSuffix: {{prefix}} With chunked upload, the files uploaded by users will be sliced into chunks and uploaded to the storage side one by one. After the upload is interrupted, users can choose to continue uploading from the last uploaded chunk.
policy.policyName: The display name of the storage policy, also used to be presented to users.

magicVar.path: The initial path while user uploads the file

policy.wanSiteURLDes: Before using this policy, please make sure that the address you entered in Basic Settings - Site Information - Site URL matches the actual address and <0>can be accessed properly by WAN</0>.
policy.enterQiniuBucket: Go to <0>Qiniu dashboard</0> to create a storage bucket. Enter the "Bucket name" you just created.
policy.bucketTypeDes: Select the type of ACL for the bucket you just created.
policy.privateDes: Cloudreve will sign the file URL.
policy.publicDes: Not recommended, Cloudreve will directly return the file's direct link, which cannot effectively control the access of files.
policy.bucketCDNDes: Fill in the CDN-accelerated domain name you have bound for the storage bucket.
policy.qiniuCredentialDes: Go to Personal Center - Credential Management in the Qiniu dashboard and fill in the obtained AK, SK.
policy.cannotEnableForPrivateBucket: If this feature is enabled for private bucket, you need to enable "Use redirected source link" for user groups.
policy.chunkSizeLabelQiniu: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 1 MB - 1 GB.
policy.editOSSStoragePolicy: Edit Alibaba Cloud OSS storage policy
policy.addOSSStoragePolicy: Add Alibaba Cloud OSS storage policy
policy.createOSSBucketDes: Go to <0>OSS Dashboard</0> to create a Bucket. Only <1>Standard</1> and <2>IA</2> storage classes are supported.
policy.ossEndpointDes: Go to Bucket summary page, enter the <2>Port</2> under <1>Access Over Internet</1> section, in <0>Endpoint</0> page.
policy.ossEndpointDesInternalHint: If you need to configure Intranet or custom domain endpoint, you can set it after creating the storage policy.
policy.obsEndpointCnameHint: If you need to configure custom domain endpoint, you can set it after creating the storage policy.
policy.ossLANEndpointDes: Leave blank means not use it. If your Cloudreve is deployed in Alibaba Cloud compute related services which are under the same availability zone as the OSS bucket, you can additionally specify a intranet endpoint, Cloudreve will try to use this endpoint on server side to reduce traffic cost.
policy.ossCDNDes: Do you want to use Alibaba Cloud CDN to speed up file access?
policy.createOSSCDNDes: Go to <0>Alibaba Cloud CDN Dashboard</0> to create a CDN domain, the source of the CDN should be your OSS bucket. Enter the CDN domain and select if you want to use HTTPS:
policy.ossAKDes: Obtain your AccessKey in <0>Security Information Management</0> page. You can also create an AccessKey with <1>AliyunOSSFullAccess</1> permission in <2>RAM Access Control</2>.
policy.chunkSizeLabelOSS: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 100 KB - 5 GB.
policy.ossCORSDes: This storage policy requires a CORS policy to enable uploading from browser. Cloudreve can set it up automatically for you, or you can set it up manually by following the steps in the documentation. If you have already set the CORS policy for this Bucket, this step can be skipped.
policy.letCloudreveHelpMe: Let Cloudreve set it for me
policy.createUpyunBucketDes: Fill in the name of the storage service you created in <0>Upyun Dashboard</0>.
policy.upyunTokenDes: It is strongly recommended to enable Token Anti-Hotlinking, go to the <0>Feature Configuration</0> panel of the created storage service, go to the <1>Access Control</1> tab, enable Token Anti-Hotlinking and set a secret.
policy.upyunTokenSecretDes: Enter the secret of the Token Anti-Hotlinking.
policy.createCOSBucketDes: Go to <0>COS Dashboard</0> to create a storage bucket. Go to the basic configuration page of the created bucket, and copy the <1>Bucket name</1> to above.
policy.obsBucketDes: Go to <0>OBS Dashboard</0> to create a storage bucket. Enter the <1>Bucket name</1> you just created. Storage class only supports <2>Standard</2> or <3>Infrequent Access</3>.
policy.cosAccessDomainDes: On the overview page of the created Bucket, fill in the <1>Access Domain</1> given under the <0>Domain Information</0> section. You can also use your CNAME domain or CDN acceleration domain.
policy.obsEndpointDes: On the overview page of the created Bucket, fill in the <1>Endpoint</1> given under the <0>Domain Information</0> section.
policy.cosCDNDomainDes: Go to <0>Tencent Cloud CDN Management Console</0> to create a CDN acceleration domain and set the source site to the COS bucket you just created. Fill in the CDN domain name below and select whether to use HTTPS.
policy.cosCredentialDes: Fill in the access keys obtained from the <0>Access Keys</0> page of Tencent Cloud. Please make sure the pair of keys has access permission to COS services. You can also create a <2>sub-user</2> with <1>Programmatic Access</1> permission and grant it access to COS service.
policy.obsCredentialDes: Fill in the access keys obtained from the <0>Access Keys</0> page of Huawei Cloud. You can also create a <2>IAM user</2> with <1>Programmatic Access</1> permission and grant it <3>OBS OperateAccess</3> permission.
policy.grantAccessLater: After creating the storage policy, you need to sign in and grant access in the storage policy settings page.
policy.odHttpsWarning: You must enable HTTPS to use OneDrive/SharePoint storage policies; after enabled, make sure to change Settings - Basic - Site Information - Site URL.
policy.creatAadAppDes: Go to <0>Microsoft Entra ID Dashboard</0>, after logging in, go to the <1>Microsoft Entra ID</1> admin panel, you can optionally use an account different from the one used to store files to login.
policy.createAadAppDes2: Go to the <0>App Registrations</0> menu on the left and click the <1>New registration</1> button. Fill out the application registration form. Make sure <2>Supported account types</2> is selected as <3>Accounts in any organizational directory (Any Azure AD directory - Multitenant) and personal Microsoft accounts (e.g. Skype, Xbox)</3>; <4>Redirect URI (optional)</4> is selected as <5>Web</5> and fill in <6>{{url}}</6>; For other fields, just leave it as default.
policy.aadAppIDDes: Go to the <0>Overview</0> page in Application Management, the value of <1>Application (Client) ID</1>.
policy.addAppSecretDes: The way to create client secret: Go to the <0>Certificates & secrets</0> menu on the left side, click the <1>New client secret</1> button, and select the longest time for the <2>Expires</2>. You need to create a new client secret after the old one expires, and update the new one in the storage policy settings.
policy.aadAccountCloudDes: Please select the endpoint according to the Microsoft 365 account type you are using.
policy.sharePointDes: Do you want to store files in SharePoint?
policy.odReverseProxyURLDes: Do you want to use custom reverse proxy server for file downloading?
policy.chunkSizeLabelOd: Allowed range: 5 MB ~ 5GB, OneDrive requires it must be an integer multiple of 320 KiB (327,680 bytes).
policy.tpsDes: Leave blank to indicate no limit. Limit this storage policy the maximum number of API requests sent to OneDrive per second. Requests that exceed this frequency will be rate-limited. When multiple Cloudreve nodes transferring files, they each use their own token bucket, so please scale this number down as appropriate in this condition.
policy.tpsBurstDes: When requested is idle, Cloudreve can reserve a specified number of slots for future bursts of traffic.
policy.odOauthDes: However, you will need to click the button below and authorize with Microsoft account login to complete the initialization before you can use it. You can re-authorize later on the Storage Policy List page.
policy.s3BucketDes: Go to AWS S3 dashboard to create a bucket, enter the <0>Bucket name</0> you just created:
policy.s3EndpointDes: Specify the EndPoint (geographical node) of the storage bucket in full URL format, e.g. <0>https://bucket.region.example.com</0>.
policy.selectRegionDes: Enter the region code of the storage bucket, e.g. <0>us-east-1</0>. For non-AWS S3 compatible storage providers, please refer to their documentation for how to fill this field.
policy.chunkSizeLabelS3: Specify the chunk size for resumable uploads. Allowed range is 5 MB - 5 GB.
policy.s3EndpointPathStyle: Select the format of the S3 Endpoint address. Some third-party S3-compatible storage policies may require this option to work. When turned on, we will force to use of path-like format addresses, such as <0>http://s3.amazonaws.com/BUCKET/KEY</0>.
policy.thumbExtDes: Leave blank to indicate that the storage policy predefined set is used. Not valid for local, S3 storage policies.
policy.driverRootDes: Choose where to save files in your OneDrive account. Changing this option will make existing files in the storage policy inaccessible.
policy.saveToDefaultOneDrive: Save files to default OneDrive driver
policy.sharePointUrlDes: Enter the SharePoint site URL. After losing focus, the system will automatically convert it to the correct driver identifier.

node.deleteNodeConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete node {{name}}?
node.thisIsMasterNodes: You are editing a master node, which is serving the current site.
node.enableNodeDes: After enabled, the node will accept and process the features that have been enabled.
node.name: Name
node.nameNode: Node name, also used to display to users.
node.serverDes: Endpoint used for node communication. If you want to store files on this node, this address will also be exposed to the user side for file uploads.
node.loadBalancerRankDes: Specify a load balancing weight for this node, the value is an integer, the higher the value, the higher the probability of being selected.
node.slaveSecretDes: Secret used for slave node communication with master node. It needs to be consistent with <1>Secret</1> in the <1>Slave</1> section of the slave node configuration file.
node.remoteDownloadDes: Accept remote download task requests. After enabled, you also need to configure the remote download related information below.
node.aria2Des: Start Aria2 as the same user/access level running Cloudreve on the target node server, enable the RPC service in the Aria2 config file, for more information and guidelines, refer the "Remote download" section of the documentation.
node.qbittorrentDes: Start qBittorrent as the same user running Cloudreve on the target node server, enable the Web UI service in the qBittorrent settings, for more information and guidelines, refer the "Remote download" section of the documentation.
node.rpcServerHelpDes: RPC server address contain full port number, e.g. <0>http://127.0.0.1:6800/</0>.
node.rpcTokenDes: Consistent with <0>rpc-secret</0> in the Aria2 configuration file; leave blank if not set.
node.downloaderOptionDes: Additional downloader configuration when creating a download task, written in JSON key-value format, see the <0>downloader official documentation</0> for available parameters.
node.refreshIntervalDes: The interval at which Cloudreve requests a refresh of the task state from the downloader. The actual refresh interval also depends on the configuration of the "Remote download" queue and the busyness of the downloader.
node.waitForSeedingDes: After enabled, when the remote download task is completed, the node will keep the task in the seeding state until the seeding completion condition in the downloader configuration is met. This feature only takes effect after the remote download task is completed, and will not affect the user's use of the downloaded files.
node.webUIEndpointDes: The endpoint of the qBittorrent Web UI, e.g. <0>http://127.0.0.1:8080/</0>.
node.tempPathDes: The directory on the node that Aria2 uses as a temporary download directory. The Cloudreve process on the node needs read, write, and execute permissions on this directory, and the downloader also needs to be able to access this directory. Leave blank to use the default temporary file path.
node.webUICredDes: Leave blank if authentication is not enabled.
node.runCrSlave: Run Cloudreve on the node with the same version as the master, and start it with the following configuration file:
node.keepIfUpload: If you need to use this node for storage policies in the future, please keep the following CORS configuration.
node.storeFilesDes: Use this node to store user files.
node.storeFilesHint: If you want to use this node for storage policies, please create a slave storage policy and select this node.
node.runCrWithConfig: Save the above file as <0>config.ini</0> file, and start Cloudreve with this file: <0>./cloudreve -c config.ini</0>. A slave Cloudreve instance can serve multiple Cloudreve master nodes; simply add this slave node to all master nodes and keep the secret same.
node.testButton: You can click the button below to test if the communication is successful.
node.hostHeaderHint: If there is a signature error, please check if the reverse proxy in front of the node is passing the <0>Host</0> header.

group.name: Name
group.nameOfGroupDes: Name of the group, used to display to users.
group.availablePoliciesDes: Select the storage policies that this group can use. Modifying this setting will not affect the files uploaded by users.
group.availablePolicyDesPro: Multi-selectable, users can freely switch storage policies within the selected range.
group.initialStorageQuotaDes: Max storage can used by single user under this group.
group.isAdminDes: When enabled, users under this group will have admin permissions.
group.allowCreateShareLinkDes: If disabled, users cannot create sharing links.
group.shareFreeDes: When enabled, users can access all paid sharing links without purchasing.
group.allowWabDAVDes: If disabled, users cannot connect to the storage via the WebDAV protocol
group.allowWabDAVProxyDes: If enabled, users can configure the WebDAV to be proxied by Cloudreve when downloading files.
group.allowCompressTaskDes: If enabled, users can create compression/decompression tasks.
group.compressTaskDes: If enabled, users can do compression/decompression for files online.
group.compressSize: Maximum file size to be compressed
group.compressSizeDes: The maximum total file size of compression jobs that can be created by the user, fill in 0 to indicate no limit. This limit is not checked when creating compression tasks, and if the total size of the original files exceeds this limit when executing, the task will fail.
group.decompressSize: Maximum file size to be decompressed
group.decompressSizeDes: The maximum total file size of decompression jobs that can be created by the user, fill in 0 to indicate no limit.
group.allowRemoteDownloadDes: Whether to allow users to create remote download tasks. If you need to use remote download, you also need to have nodes with remote download enabled in the <0>Node List</0>.
group.aria2OptionsDes: Extra parameters for downloaders (qBittorrent or Aria2), written in JSON key-value format, see the downloader official documentation for available parameters.
group.aria2BatchSize: Max batch size of remote download tasks
group.aria2BatchSizeDes: Max number for submitting batched remote download tasks, fill in 0 to indicate no limit.
group.migratePolicyDes: Whether the user creates a storage policy relocation task.
group.advanceDeleteDes: Once enabled, users can choose whether to keep physical files when deleting files. Please only enable this option for trusted user groups.
group.allowSelectNodeDes: When enabled, user can select preferred node before creating tasks. When disabled, the node will be load-balanced by system within the allowed nodes for the group.
group.allowedNodesDes: Specify the nodes that this group can use to create tasks. Empty list means all nodes are available. Users can only select or be assigned nodes within this list by load balancer. Currently, the tasks covered are: remote download, file compression/decompression. Other tasks will be assigned to the master node.
group.esclateAnonymityDes: When enabled, users can assign higher permissions for anonymous users (write/delete/create). When disabled, users can only assign read-only permission for anonymous users. Changing this setting will not affect existing sharing links or files.
group.allowDownloadShareDes: When disabled, users cannot view others' shared links. This setting takes precedence over the sharing link permission settings.
group.maxWalkedFilesDes: In some operations that require deep traversal of files, the maximum number of files allowed to be traversed.
group.trashBinDurationDes: The retention time of files in the trash bin, files will be permanently deleted after the expiration time. Changing this setting will not affect files already in the trash bin.
group.serverSideBatchDownloadDes: Whether to allow users to select multiple files to use the server-side relay batch download, after disabled, users can still use the pure browser-based batch download feature.
group.getDirectLinkDes: Whether to allow users to get the direct link of the file.
group.bathSourceLinkLimit: Max size of batch direct links
group.bathSourceLinkLimitDes: The maximum number of files allowed for users to obtain direct links in a single batch, fill in 0 means no batch generation of direct links is allowed.
group.redirectedSourceDes: Recommended to enable. When enabled, the direct link to the file obtained by the user will be redirected by Cloudreve with a shorter link. When disabled, the direct link to the file obtained by the user becomes the original URL to the file, and is bound to the file version. Some policies produce non-redirected direct links that do not remain persistent; see Cloudreve documents for details.
group.reuseDirectLinkDes: When enabled, multiple requests for the same file's direct link will reuse the existing redirect link.
group.downloadSpeedLimitDes: Fill in 0 to indicate no limit. When the restriction is turned on, the maximum download speed will be limited when users download all files under the storage policy that supports the speed limit.
group.anonymousHint: This user group corresponds to the anonymous visitor who is not signed in.
group.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete group {{group}}?

user.originUserGroupDes: User group that the user belongs to before purchasing the current group, the current group will revert to this group after expiration.
user.groupExpiredDes: ISO8601 format group expired date, leave blank means the group is permanent.
user.groupDes: Group that the user belongs to.
user.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete user {{user}}?
user.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} users?

file.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} files?
file.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete file {{file}}?
file.creator: Creator
file.name: File name
file.deleteAsync: Delete task will be executed in background.
file.importTaskCreated: Import task created, you can view its status in the background tasks list.
file.manuallyPathOnly: The selected storage policy only supports manually inputting path.
file.importExternalFolderDes: You can import existing files and directory structures from your storage policy into Cloudreve. The import operation will not take up additional physical storage, but will still deduct the user's used storage quota as normal.
file.storagePolicyDes: Select the storage policy where the files to be imported are currently stored.
file.targetUserDes: Select which user's file system you want to import the files to.
file.selectSrcDes: The path of the directory to be imported on the storage side.
file.dstFolderPathDes: Path in the user's file system to hold all imported files.
file.recursivelyImportDes: Whether to import all subdirectories under the directory recursively.
file.searchUser: Search user by name or email...
file.extractMediaMetaDes: Whether to extract media information for each file during import.
importWarnings: After import, the physical file will be taken over by Cloudreve, please do not modify it externally afterwards.
Do not import the same file multiple times.
If the user's file conflicts, this file will be skipped.

entity.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} Blobs?
entity.forceDeleteDes: Whether to delete the Blob record regardless of whether the physical file is deleted.

event.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this event?
event.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} events?

share.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} shares?
share.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this share?

task.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this task?
task.confirmBatchDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{num}} tasks?

vas.disableSubAddressEmailDes: After enabled, email addresses containing <0>+</0> cannot be used for sign-up.
vas.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete these orders?
vas.initialFilesDes: Specify the files that the user initially owns after signups. Enter a file ID to search existing files.
vas.filterEmailProviderDes: Restrict the email provider for registration, third-party SSO login is not restricted.
vas.filterEmailProviderRuleDes: Separate multiple fields with a semi-colon comma.
vas.qqConnectHint: When creating the application, please fill in the callback URL: {{url}}
vas.enableQQConnectDes: Whether to allow binding QQ, use QQ to login website.
vas.loginWithoutBindingDes: After enabled, if a user sign-in from the 3rd-party but does not have a linked account, the system will create an account for them. Users sign-in this way will only be able to sign in using this 3rd-party in the future.
vas.appidDes: The APP ID obtained from the application management page.
vas.appKeyDes: The APP KEY obtained from the application management page.
vas.overuseReminderDes: Reminder email template sent to users after their capacity exceeds the limit due to expired VAS.
vas.rsaPrivateDes: The RSA2 (SHA256) private key for the payment application, typically generated by you. For details, refer to <0>Generating RSA Keys</0>.
vas.alipayPublicKeyDes: Provided by Alipay, available in Application Management - Application Information - API Signing Method.
vas.applicationIDDes: Public number or mobile application appid applied by merchants.
vas.merchantIDDes: The merchant number generated and issued by WeChat Pay.
vas.apiV3SecretDes: The merchant needs to set the secret in [Merchant Platform] - [API Security] before the request WeChat Pay. The length of the key is 32 bytes.
vas.mcCertificateSerialDes: Navigate to [API Security] - [API Certificate] - [View Certificate] to view the merchant API certificate serial number.
vas.mcAPISecretDes: Content of the secret file apiclient_key.pem.
vas.payjsWarning: This service is provided by <0>PAYJS</0>, a third-party platform, and any disputes arising from it are not the responsibility of Cloudreve developers.
vas.mcNumberDes: Available in the PAYJS admin panel home page.
vas.banBufferPeriodDes: The maximum length of time that a user can maintain the capacity overage status, beyond which the user will be suspend by the system.
vas.allowSellSharesDes: Once enabled users can set a credit price for sharing and credit will be deducted for downloading.
vas.creditPriceRatioDes: The rate of credits actually arriving to the sharer for the purchase of a share with a set price for download.
vas.name: Name
vas.durationDayDes: Valid duration of each storage pack.
vas.priceCreditsDes: The price when using credits to buy, fill in 0 means you can't use credits to buy.
vas.durationGroupDes: The validity of the purchase time of the user group unit upgraded after the purchase.
vas.productDescriptionDes: Description of the product displayed on the purchase page.
vas.highlightDes: After enabled, it will be highlighted on the product selection page.
vas.numberOfCodesDes: Number of gift codes to generate.
vas.productQytDes: For credit products, this is the number of points and other products are multiples of durations.
vas.freeDownloadDes: After enabled, user can download paid shares for free.
vas.showAppPromotionDes: After enabled, user can see the guidance page for mobile application in "Connect & Mount" page.
vas.customPaymentNameDes: Name of the payment method used to display to the user.
vas.customPaymentSecretDes: Secret key for signing payment requests.
vas.customPaymentEndpointDes: URL to be requested when creating a payment order.
vas.appLinkDes: Will be displayed in mobile client, leave empty to hide menu item. This setting will take effect only if VOL license is valid.

pro.title: Pro edition exclusive features
pro.description: The feature you are trying to access is only available in the Cloudreve Pro edition, upgrade to unlock all advanced features.
pro.multipleStoragePolicy: Multiple storage policies and directory storage policy switching
